title: 050 Conditional inclusion and conditional function signature modification
To conditionally include a block of code, the preprocessor has several directives (e.g
#if
c
#ifdef
c
#else
c
#endif
c
, etc).

inline_content.Text: To conditionally include a block of code, the preprocessor has several directives (e.g

title:
/* Defines a conditional `printf` macro, which only prints if `DEBUG`
 * has been defined
 */
#ifdef DEBUG
#define DLOG(x) (printf(x))
#else
#define DLOG(x)
#endif

content_resolved.code:
/* Defines a conditional `printf` macro, which only prints if `DEBUG`
 * has been defined
 */
#ifdef DEBUG
#define DLOG(x) (printf(x))
#else
#define DLOG(x)
#endif

c
directives behaves similar to the C
if
c

defined( identifier )

c

title: In most cases a release build of an application is expected to have as little overhead as possible. However during testing of an interim build, additional logs and information about problems found can be helpful.

inline_content.Text: In most cases a release build of an application is expected to have as little overhead as possible. However during testing of an interim build, additional logs and information about problems found can be helpful.

title: For example assume there is some function
SHORT SerOpPluAllRead(PLUIF *pPif, USHORT usLockHnd)
c

which when doing a test build it is desired will generate a log about its use. However this function is used in multiple places and it is desired that when generating the log, part of the information is to know where is the function being called from.

inline_content.Text: For example assume there is some function

which when doing a test build it is desired will generate a log about its use. However this function is used in multiple places and it is desired that when generating the log, part of the information is to know where is the function being called from.

title: So using conditional compilation you can have something like the following in the include file declaring the function. This replaces the standard version of the function with a debug version of the function. The preprocessor is used to replace calls to the function
SerOpPluAllRead()
c
with calls to the function
SerOpPluAllRead_Debug()
c
with two additional arguments, the name of the file and the line number of where the function is used.

inline_content.Text: So using conditional compilation you can have something like the following in the include file declaring the function. This replaces the standard version of the function with a debug version of the function. The preprocessor is used to replace calls to the function
with two additional arguments, the name of the file and the line number of where the function is used.

title: Conditional compilation is used to choose whether to override the standard function with a debug version or not.

inline_content.Text: Conditional compilation is used to choose whether to override the standard function with a debug version or not.

title: This allows you to override the standard version of the function
SerOpPluAllRead()
c
with a version that will provide the name of the file and line number in the file of where the function is called.

inline_content.Text: This allows you to override the standard version of the function
with a version that will provide the name of the file and line number in the file of where the function is called.

title: There is one important consideration:
b
any file using this function must include the header file where this approach is used in order for the preprocessor to modify the function. Otherwise you will see a linker error.
i

inline_content.Text: any file using this function must include the header file where this approach is used in order for the preprocessor to modify the function. Otherwise you will see a linker error.

title: The definition of the function would look something like the following. What this source does is to request that the preprocessor rename the function
SerOpPluAllRead()
c
to be
SerOpPluAllRead_Debug()
c
and to modify the argument list to include two additional arguments, a pointer to the name of the file where the function was called and the line number in the file at which the function is used.

inline_content.Text: The definition of the function would look something like the following. What this source does is to request that the preprocessor rename the function
and to modify the argument list to include two additional arguments, a pointer to the name of the file where the function was called and the line number in the file at which the function is used.
